data.name: Character point pools
data.descr: Allowed point pools for character generation.

data.name: World end handling
data.descr: Handling of game world when last character dies.

data.name: Wander spawns
data.descr: Emulation of zombie hordes.  Zombie spawn points wander around cities and may go to noise.  Must reset world directory after changing for it to take effect.

data.name: Surrounded start
data.descr: If true, spawn zombies at shelters.  Makes the starting game a lot harder.

data.name: Static NPCs
data.descr: If true, static NPCs will spawn at pre-defined locations.  Requires world reset.

data.name: Starting NPCs spawn
data.descr: Determines whether starting NPCs should spawn, and if they do, how exactly.

data.name: Random NPCs
data.descr: If true, the game will randomly spawn NPCs during gameplay.

data.name: Mutations by radiation
data.descr: If true, radiation causes the player to mutate.

data.name: Initial time
data.descr: Initial starting time of day on character generation.

data.name: Initial day
data.descr: How many days into the year the cataclysm occurred.  Day 0 is Spring 1.  Day -1 randomizes the start date.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  This does not advance food rot or monster evolution.

data.name: Spawn delay
data.descr: How many days after the cataclysm the player spawns.  Day 0 is the day of the cataclysm.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  Increasing this will cause food rot and monster evolution to advance.

data.name: Season length
data.descr: Season length, in days.

data.name: Construction scaling
data.descr: Sets the time of construction in percents.  '50' is two times faster than default, '200' is two times longer.  '0' automatically scales construction time to match the world's season length.

data.name: Eternal season
data.descr: Keep the initial season for ever.

data.name: Size of cities
data.descr: A number determining how large cities are.  0 disables cities, roads and any scenario requiring a city start.

data.name: City spacing
data.descr: A number determining how far apart cities are.  Warning, small numbers lead to very slow mapgen.

data.name: Spawn rate scaling factor
data.descr: A scaling factor that determines density of monster spawns.

data.name: Carrion spawn rate scaling factor
data.descr: A scaling factor that determines how often creatures spawn from rotting material.

data.name: Item spawn scaling factor
data.descr: A scaling factor that determines density of item spawns.

data.name: NPC spawn rate scaling factor
data.descr: A scaling factor that determines density of dynamic NPC spawns.

data.name: Monster evolution scaling factor
data.descr: A scaling factor that determines the time between monster upgrades.  A higher number means slower evolution.  Set to 0.00 to turn off monster upgrades.

data.name: Monster speed
data.descr: Determines the movement rate of monsters.  A higher value increases monster speed and a lower reduces it.  Requires world reset.

data.name: Monster resilience
data.descr: Determines how much damage monsters can take.  A higher value makes monsters more resilient and a lower makes them more flimsy.  Requires world reset.

data.name: Default region type
data.descr: ( WIP feature ) Determines terrain, shops, plants, and more.

data.name: Z-levels
data.descr: If true, enables several features related to vertical movement, such as hauling items up stairs, climbing downspouts, and flying aircraft.  May cause problems if toggled mid-game.

data.name: Core version data
data.descr: Controls what migrations are applied for legacy worlds

data.name: Disables lifting requirements for vehicle parts.
data.descr: If true, strength checks and/or lifting qualities no longer need to be met in order to change parts.
